Class MainClass

java.lang.Object
nameExtractor.MainClass
public class MainClass extends Object
Main entry point for the Name Extractor application.

This class reads a list of Java repositories, optionally performs code refactoring, and collects statistics about code elements (like variable names and loops) using JavaParser.

Usage: java MainClass <r> Where <r> = 0 (no refactoring) or 1 (perform refactoring)

Author:

  • Constructor Details

    • MainClass

      public MainClass()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException
      Main method to start the application. The program expects one argument:
      • 0 – do not perform refactoring
      • 1 – perform refactoring
      After validating the argument, it reads the list of repositories from repositories.txt and processes each repository.
      Parameters:
      args - command-line arguments (expects exactly one: the refactoring flag)
      Throws:
      IOException - if reading the repository list fails

    • processRepository

      private static void processRepository(String repo, int r)
      Processes a single repository: parses files, extracts loops, categorizes and refactors.
      Parameters:
      repo - Repository name.
      r - Refactoring flag (0 = just inspect repo, 1 = perform refactoring).

    • printRepositoryStatistics

      private static void printRepositoryStatistics(int forStmtCount, int forEachStmtCount)
      Prints loop analysis summary for a repository.
      Parameters:
      forStmtCount - Number of classic ForStmt loops.
      forEachStmtCount - Number of advanced ForEachStmt loops.

    • refactorFor

      private static void refactorFor()
      Refactors Java for-loops and for-each statements in source files using provided transformation data. Reads compilable files, locates target statements by line number, replaces them with the transformed code, and attempts to compile them while preserving the original files.

    • loadCompilableFiles

      private static HashSet<String> loadCompilableFiles() throws IOException
      Reads the list of compilable files from the predefined result text file.
      Returns:
      Set of compilable file names with "compile_" prefix removed.
      Throws:
      IOException - if reading the file fails

    • processTransformationFile

      private static void processTransformationFile(Path transformationFile, Set<String> compilableFiles)
      Processes a single transformation file by locating the corresponding source Java file, replacing the target for-loop/for-each statement with the new stream-based code, and compiling the modified file.
      Parameters:
      transformationFile - Path to the file containing transformed code
      compilableFiles - Set of compilable files to filter against

    • categorizeFor

      private static void categorizeFor(String filename, HashSet<com.github.javaparser.ast.stmt.ForStmt> forStmts, HashSet<com.github.javaparser.ast.stmt.ForEachStmt> forEachStmts)
      Categorizes traditional for-loops and for-each statements in a given file. For each statement, it extracts individual statements, increments the global count, and applies labelling logic.
      Parameters:
      filename - Original file name
      forStmts - Set of traditional for statements
      forEachStmts - Set of for-each statements

    • processLoopStatement

      private static void processLoopStatement(com.github.javaparser.ast.stmt.Statement loopStmt, String filename)
      Helper method to process a single loop statement: extract line number, statements, increment counter, and apply labelling.
      Parameters:
      loopStmt - Statement to process (ForStmt or ForEachStmt)
      filename - Original file name

    • labelling

      private static void labelling(com.github.javaparser.ast.stmt.Statement loopStmt, ArrayList<String> statements, String filename)
      Labels a given loop statement based on its characteristics and templates. Creates corresponding directories and writes the statement to files for each label.
      Parameters:
      loopStmt - The loop statement to be labeled
      statements - List of statement types inside the loop (e.g., "ReturnStmt", "TryStmt")
      filename - The filename to use when saving the labeled statement

    • incrementAndWrite

      private static void incrementAndWrite(com.github.javaparser.ast.stmt.Statement loopStmt, String filename, AtomicInteger counter, String category)
      Increments the given counter and writes the loop statement to the specified category.
      Parameters:
      loopStmt - The loop statement to write
      filename - Filename for saving
      counter - Atomic counter to increment
      category - Category folder name

    • writeToCategory

      private static void writeToCategory(com.github.javaparser.ast.stmt.Statement loopStmt, String filename, String category)
      Creates the directory for the category if it doesn't exist and writes the statement to a file.
      Parameters:
      loopStmt - The loop statement to write
      filename - Filename for saving
      category - Category folder name

    • checkLocalVars

      private static boolean checkLocalVars(com.github.javaparser.ast.stmt.Statement stmt)
      Checks whether a loop statement contains only local variable assignments. It returns true if there is at most one assignment outside the declared variables.
      Parameters:
      stmt - The loop statement to check
      Returns:
      true if all assignments are local or at most one non-local assignment, false otherwise
